intro: Hansemannia pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by spherical, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique adaptations, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
